awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences:  Boundary Value Problems of Free     Surface Hydrodynamics
awd_abstract_narration: This research considers a simplified approach to two free surface               boundary problems in ship hydrodynamics.  The first is the                      linearized mixed boundary value problem of low-aspect ratio flat                ship theory; and the second is the nonlinear problem of low                     Froude number flow past the blunt bow of a tanker.                                                                                                              The principal investigator is a recent recipient of the doctorate               and has made good progress in developing a research program.                    This work in applied mathematics is of significant interest to                  ship hydrodynamicists, and will be supported in part by the                     Office of Naval Research.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

pgm_ref.pgm_ref_txt: REU SUPP-Res Exp for Ugrd Supp
